message.content:
cs.HC, cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.CL, cs.IR. 

The paper describes a gamified crowdsourcing system that targets knowledgeable users on the Internet through advertising campaigns. The system involves users completing short quizzes on specific topics, and the system estimates the user's competence based on their answers. The paper discusses experiments involving over ten thousand users and examines the effect of various incentive mechanisms. The paper also discusses the cost-quality analysis of the approach, which is below that of hiring workers through paid-crowdsourcing platforms. Based on this information, the most likely sub-category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), followed by cs.CY (Computers and Society), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
